channel.title: Posts on Yuan Tian
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Yuan Tian

item.title: Functional Programming in Scala
item.description: Functional programming (FP) finally goes mainstream. It is not a new concept, but it is absolutely a complex one for beginners including me. I got exposed to a large set of references, online courses and books, and I will try to organize them in a useful way. Why Functional Programming (FP)? Why Scala? I enjoyed the talk given by Martin Odersky, which answer the two key questions with very simple code examples.

item.title: R for Data Science: Get ALL the Exercises Done!
item.description: 1. Data Visulization with ggplot2 The mpg dataset examples The diamonds dataset examples Position Adjustment and Coordinate Systems Summary on ggplot 2. Workflow:Basics & Shortcuts (print,<-,Alt+Shift+K,tab) 3. Data Transformation with dplyr Filter Rows with filter() Reorder/sort the rows with arrange() Pick variables by names with select() Create new variables with functions of existing variables with mutate() Collapse many values to a summary statistics with summarize() Workflow scripts and Exploratory Data Analysis Reference: R for Data Science: Import, Tidy, Transform, Visualize, and Model Data

item.title: Key Commands about Git and GitHub Shell
item.description: Thanks to the Step-by-Step Instruction provided by ALISON PRESMANES HILL and “Blogdown: Creating Websites with R Markdown”, I was able to create this website. The repository of this website is kept on Git. When I tried to get refreshed on the common Git commands, I came across this wonderful Guide to Git Shell. This post is merely a note on the key common Git commands and core workflow in Git Shell (although you can complete all these actions via Git Desktop without interfering with the Shell).

item.title: How to Lie with Statistics
item.description: This little book stands the test of time for over half a century. It has numerous hilarious examples regarding the ways that statistics might be biased. I love the author’s comments in the introduction: The crooks already know these tricks,honest men must learn them in self-dense. 1. Is it a trully representative sample of the studied population? We encountered a key question when interpreting the sample data in the real world:Is the sample a representative sample of the studied population?

item.title: Hello World Testing
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: Getting started with the Academic framework for Hugo
item.description: Create a beautifully simple personal or academic website in under 10 minutes.

item.title: Customizing the homepage with widgets
item.description: Enable/disable and configure widgets to customize your homepage.

item.title: Writing content with Markdown, LaTeX, and Shortcodes
item.description: Content can be written using Markdown, LaTeX math, and Hugo Shortcodes. Additionally, HTML may be used for advanced formatting.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: Migrate from Jekyll to Hugo
item.description: Learn how to migrate an existing website from Jekyll to Hugo.
